description:
I'm a guitarists and I use this program for transcribing songs. Some of the great features I like about this program:
1) Unlike Audacit for example, its footprint is tiny. No MP3/WAV file cloning when analyzing audio files.
2) Layers are great - text, segments etc..
3) Easy way to mark region and loop them
4) Changing tempo (without affecting pitch) is just mouse-wheel scroll away..

Many other cool stuff. Great work guys !

We rely on Sonic Visualiser on a daily basis. As the Executive Producer of a daily syndicated radio broadcast program, SV has been indispensible as a quick, consistent and light weight tool to study and vet audio through our QC. Audacity, Audition, FL and Protools are all in our stable but Sonic Visualiser is the go to for our final proofing and pre-shipping checks. Well done!
This is the best audio analysis software.
The absolute best open source audio analysis application I have seen so far!

In preferences there are several audio settings. I have tried them all, including the auto settings for all. Even though Rhythmbox has no issue playing through my bluetooth speakers, THIS app can't figure out how to play audio at all. It shows the audio rather beautifully. I like the visualizations. But if you cannot hear the audio at the same time it is kind of pointless. I don't get why there isn't just a pass-through mode, where audio playing on one app also stimulates the visualizations in this app. Loading individual mp3 files is rather tedious. We have apps that make mp3 management easier (dedicated players). Either make this more of an mp3 manager or make it possible to pipe output from Rhythmbox or whatever to this app. And regardless, pipe the audio OUT to the speakers!
